Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the photo is of Chris Stevens, when in fact it is not.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible sources provided to prove that the photo is of Chris Stevens.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Chris Stevens was not tortured and raped before his death, as confirmed by government reviews, media reports, and video footage.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the photo is evidence of the false claim that Stevens was tortured.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the photo has been circulating on the internet since before Stevens' death and is unrelated to him.
